response_parsed.title: Type-Checking REST APIs with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to utilize the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+ to develop and type-check robust REST APIs.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, easy-to-use, and fast web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+
Type checking is an essential feature of FastAPI that ensures input data validity, prevents errors, and improves API reliability.
FastAPI supports automatic documentation generation based on the structure of your code, making it easy to use and understand for developers.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Body
app = FastAPI()

@app.post('/create-user/')
async def create_user(user: User = Body(...)):
   pass

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to utilize FastAPI and its features, such as type checking.
Make sure your Python environment is up-to-date before installing FastAPI.
caveats: Ensure that you have the necessary dependencies installed (e.g., Uvicorn for running your API).
Properly define the structure of your data models to enable type checking, as shown in the examples above.
FastAPI supports multiple programming paradigms, but this example focuses on Functional Programming.
